entries.title: Brazil elections: Cheers and tears as Lula beats Bolsonaro
entries.description: Supporters of the left-wing leader erupt with joy as Bolsonaro fails to win a second term in power.

entries.title: The Papers: 'Migrant centre horror' and 'PM mulls COP U-turn'
entries.description: Many of Monday's newspapers report details of an attack at a migrant centre in Dover.

entries.title: Brixton shooting: Two men dead after reports of gunshots
entries.description: Police say two men were pronounced dead at the scene following the incident on Sunday evening.

entries.title: I work alone at night in Edinburgh's dark and spooky vaults
entries.description: The tunnels in Edinburgh's Old Town have a grizzly history - but Jamie Corstorphine finds them peaceful.

entries.title: Beau Greaves beats Fallon Sherrock to PDC World Championship place
entries.description: Teenager Beau Greaves throws a record women's average of 107.86 as she beats Fallon Sherrock to a place in the PDC World Championship at Alexandra Palace.

entries.title: Man Utd: 'Marcus Rashford's form means he starts for England' - Jermaine Jenas analysis
entries.description: MOTD2 pundit Jermaine Jenas says on current form Marcus Rashford should not just make England's World Cup squad, he should start in Qatar.

entries.title: Cost of living: Swansea estate cuts bills by generating energy
entries.description: People on a Swansea estate are reducing bills by sharing solar panels and storing the power.

entries.title: Mexico City Grand Prix: Max Verstappen wins from Lewis Hamilton
entries.description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen broke the record for wins in a season with a comfortable and controlled victory in the Mexico City Grand Prix.

entries.title: Garth Crooks' Team of the Week: Who is playing like a future Ballon d'Or winner?
entries.description: Who is playing like a future Ballon d'Or winner? Who would Gareth Southgate be brave to overlook for England? It's Garth Crooks' team of the week.

entries.title: Arsenal 3-1 West Ham: Gunners come from behind to set winning record
entries.description: Arsenal come from behind to beat West Ham and set a new Women's Super League record of 13 successive wins.

entries.title: David de Gea: Erik ten Hag praises 'great' Man Utd goalkeeper after win over West Ham
entries.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag believes David de Gea is a "great" goalkeeper and rejects the notion the Spain international cannot play with his feet.

entries.title: Switzerland sets record with world's longest passenger train
entries.description: The 1.9km (1.2 mile) long train, which is composed of 100 coaches, has completed a 25km journey.

entries.title: Manchester United 1-0 West Ham: Marcus Rashford's landmark goal seals victory
entries.description: Marcus Rashford scores his 100th goal for Manchester United as the Red Devils beat West Ham to move above Chelsea into fifth in the Premier League.

entries.title: Bukayo Saka: Arsenal winger 'hopefully not' a World Cup doubt, says Mikel Arteta
entries.description: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta says he hopes the injury sustained by Bukayo Saka in Sunday's win over Nottingham Forest will not threaten the player's World Cup participation with England.

entries.title: Real Madrid 1-1 Girona: Toni Kroos sent off as champions go top with draw
entries.description: Toni Kroos is sent off for the first time in his career as unbeaten Real Madrid go top of La Liga thanks to a draw with Girona.

entries.title: Saracens 33-22 Sale: Alex Goode stars as Sarries maintain winning run
entries.description: Alex Goode marks his record-breaking 339th game with a 12-point haul as Saracens hold off Sale to make it seven wins from seven.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Miller and Markram smash South Africa to victory
entries.description: David Miller and Aiden Makram both hit half-centuries to propel South Africa to a five-wicket win over India at the T20 World Cup.

entries.title: Arsenal 5-0 Nottingham Forest: Gunners thrash struggling Forest to go top
entries.description: Arsenal bounce back from Thursday's Europa League loss to PSV Eindhoven by returning to the top of the Premier League table with an emphatic win over Nottingham Forest.

entries.title: Royal Mail staff call off planned strike action
entries.description: The strikes planned for the next two weeks will not take place but action will resume on 12 November.

entries.title: Hundreds plunge into river after India bridge collapses
entries.description: The suspension bridge collapse in Gujarat kills at least 32 people as hundreds are thrown into a river.

entries.title: Lewis Hamilton reacts to Fernando Alonso comments about value of his seven titles
entries.description: After Fernando Alonso questions the value of Lewis Hamilton's seven world titles, the Mercedes driver responds on social media.

entries.title: South Korea: How the Halloween tragedy unfolded
entries.description: The incident occurred on Saturday night, as tens of thousands celebrated Halloween in Itaewon.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: South Africa secure thrilling win over India
entries.description: South Africa move to the top of Group 2 with a nervy five-wicket victory over India at the Men's T20 World Cup in Perth.

entries.title: WSL: Nikita Parris gives Manchester United an early lead against Everton
entries.description: Watch as Manchester United's Nikita Parris scores to give her side an early lead over Everton in the Women's Super League.

entries.title: King to hold event to mark COP27 summit he will miss
entries.description: King Charles is not going to the climate conference, but will host a pre-summit gathering in London.

entries.title: Seoul Halloween crush disaster: Mourners lay flowers at scene
entries.description: People gather to pay their respects with prayers and tributes near the scene of the disaster in central Seoul.

entries.title: Reports of petrol bombs thrown at migrant centre
entries.description: A Reuters witness says a man threw petrol bombs at the immigration centre in Dover before killing himself.

entries.title: Liverpool: Trent Alexander-Arnold says 'something's not going right' after Leeds defeat
entries.description: Trent Alexander-Arnold says "something's not going right" with Liverpool after a second successive Premier League defeat.

entries.title: Michael Gove commits to 300,000 homes target
entries.description: Former PM Liz Truss had cast doubt on the aim, saying she would scrap "Stalinist" housing targets.

entries.title: Wasps: Offer to buy Premiership club accepted by joint administrators
entries.description: Wasps' joint administrators say they have accepted an offer, subject to contract, to buy the stricken Premiership club.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Suryakumar Yadav's counter attack gives India hope
entries.description: Suryakumar Yadav scores 68 to help India to a total of 133-9 against South Africa at the T20 World Cup.

entries.title: Channel migrants: Nearly 1,000 people cross in single day
entries.description: The Ministry of Defence said 990 people arrived on Saturday, bringing this year's total to 39,430.

entries.title: S Korea Halloween crush: 'I was trapped on ledge, watching people die'
entries.description: Survivors have been speaking of their horror at watching friends and strangers suffocate.

entries.title: Philip Hammond: Raise taxes for all to improve services
entries.description: Lord Philip Hammond says all earners will need to see higher taxes if public services are to improve.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: India's Virat Kohli top edges to fine leg against South Africa
entries.description: India batter Virat Kohli is dismissed for the first time in three matches at the T20 World Cup, top edging South Africa's Lungi Ngidi to fine leg for 12 runs.

entries.title: How much grain has been shipped from Ukraine?
entries.description: Russia says it's pulling out of the deal to allow Ukraine to export grain by sea. How much was shipped?

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Bangladesh prevail amid last-ball drama
entries.description: Bangladesh beat Zimbabwe by three runs after the teams are called back onto the field when the final delivery is called as no-ball after the teams had already shaken hands.

entries.title: Somalia Mogadishu bombings: Twin blasts kill 100 in capital
entries.description: The president blames al-Shabab militants for being behind what he describes as a cowardly attack.

entries.title: Do not intervene with Just Stop Oil protests, Met urges
entries.description: The force made the plea after several members of the public took matters into their own hands.

entries.title: Moreton murder inquiry: Man, 79, held after woman shot
entries.description: The suspect was known to the woman whose body was found with a gunshot wound, police say.

entries.title: Suella Braverman email could throw fresh doubt over security breach claims
entries.description: An email shows the home secretary asked the recipient of a highly sensitive message to "delete and ignore it".

entries.title: Manchester United's Tony Whelan: The man helping nurture the club's future stars
entries.description: BBC Sport speaks to Tony Whelan, the Manchester United academy programme advisor who helped nurture Marcus Rashford, Jesse Lingard, Danny Welbeck and Paul Pogba.

entries.title: Match of the Day: What went wrong for Chelsea as Graham Potter returned to Brighton?
entries.description: Match of the Day's Ian Wright analyses the way Brighton exposed Chelsea's wing-back system during their 4-1 Premier League victory.

entries.title: Rugby World Cup: England's Sarah Hunter warns of New Zealand threat
entries.description: England captain Sarah Hunter says anyone believing they would ease to the Rugby World Cup title was not being "respectful" of an increasingly impressive New Zealand team.

entries.title: Keeping tips from workers could be illegal under new law
entries.description: Under a new law, employers would have to pay workers all their tips without any deductions.

entries.title: Luca Kumahara: The three-time Olympian aiming to be the next trans trailblazer
entries.description: Luca Kumahara has represented Brazil at table tennis in the last three Olympics. However his latest challenge has been his biggest.

entries.title: T20 World Cup: Bangladesh beat Zimbabwe in dramatic ending
entries.description: Bangladesh survive an remarkable finale to beat Zimbabwe by three runs in an exciting Men's T20 World Cup game in Brisbane.

entries.title: Jake Paul beats Anderson Silva on points to remain undefeated as boxer
entries.description: YouTube star Jake Paul is now undefeated in six boxing fights after beating UFC legend Anderson Silva on points.

entries.title: Seoul Halloween crush: Aftermath of disaster in pictures
entries.description: Images from South Korea reveal how Halloween revellers met with disaster in a giant crush.

entries.title: Itaewon crowd crush: 'I could not catch their pulse or breath'
entries.description: Witnesses describe the horror of being jammed in a crowd who had gone to celebrate Halloween.

entries.title: Nancy Pelosi: We are traumatised by hammer attack
entries.description: The US House Speaker says her family is grateful for warm wishes as her husband recovers in hospital.

entries.title: Rugby World Cup: England 41-5 Australia - Marlie Packer hat-trick in quarter-final victory
entries.description: England reach the Rugby World Cup semi-finals as they grind out victory against Australia in horrendously wet Auckland conditions.

entries.title: No one chooses to become an addict, says Catherine
entries.description: The Princess of Wales sends a message telling people with addictions not to be ashamed to get help.

entries.title: Ford Fiesta fans on why they love their cars
entries.description: As Ford announces the end of the Fiesta, keen fans sing its praises and mourn its loss.

entries.title: Lebanon cholera: 'We're afraid of everything now'
entries.description: The infectious disease is spreading fast in a country ill-equipped to stop it.

entries.title: Why is there a global energy crisis and who might suffer most from it?
entries.description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine has led to soaring energy prices, threatening supply to the world's poorest.

entries.title: Cost of living: Deptford charity turns phone box into community hub
entries.description: An old phone box has been helping people struggling with the rising costs of living in Deptford.

entries.title: Cost of living: 'We've only got 30p left on our prepayment meter'
entries.description: A mother says having a prepayment meter installed has made her situation "exponentially worse".

entries.title: Inside a US military cyber team’s defence of Ukraine
entries.description: A little-known US team that hunts global adversaries has helped protect Ukraine from cyber attacks.

entries.title: UK museums willing to return skulls to Zimbabwe
entries.description: Several Zimbabwean skulls were found in archives but none belong to Zimbabwe's anti-colonial heroes.

entries.title: Mexico City Grand Prix: George Russell believes as Mercedes eye win
entries.description: George Russell believes Mercedes have a "reasonable shot" of winning the Mexico City Grand Prix.
